revisions.rev:
{{ NCAATeamSeason | Mode = football | Year = 1906 | Team = Nebraska Cornhuskers | Logo = | LogoSize = | LogoAlt = | Image = 1906 Nebraska Cornhuskers football team.jpg | ImageSize = | ImageAlt = | Conference = Independent | Division = | ShortConference = | BCSRank = | CoachRank = | APRank = | Record = 6-4-0 | ConfRecord = | WinsVacated = | WinsForfeited = | ConfWinsVacated = | ConfWinsForfeited = | HeadCoach = [[Amos Foster]] | HCYear = 1st | OffCoach = | OCYear = | DefCoach = | DCYear = | OScheme = | DScheme = | StadiumArena = Antelope Field | Champion = Nebraska State Champions | BowlTourney = | BowlTourneyResult = | ConfChamp = | ConfChampResult = }} The '''1906 Nebraska Cornhuskers football team''' was the representative of the [[University of Nebraska-Lincoln|University of Nebraska]] in the [[1906 college football season]]. The team was coached by [[Amos Foster]] and played their home games at Antelope Field in [[Lincoln, Nebraska]]. ==Before the season== New coach Foster arrived to replace previous coach [[Walter C. Booth]], after compiling an 11-4 record in two years coaching for the [[University of Cincinnati]]. New rules going into effect this year significantly changed the way the game was played, including an increase in the distance required to get a first down to ten yards, and also that an incomplete pass would be considered a turnover. Nebraska's existing schemes were not built around these new rules, and bringing in a new coach also unsettled affairs somewhat going into the season. ==Schedule== {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskers.com/SportSelect.dbml?SPSID=3&SPID=22&DB_OEM_ID=100&KEY=&Q_SEASON=1906 |title =Football - 1906 Schedule/Results |accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=University of Nebraska-Lincoln Athletics Department}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Date ! Opponent ! Site ! Result ! Stewart'''|||Assistant Coach||align="center"|1906||align="center"|1906||[[University of Michigan|Michigan]] |}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/coaches.html|title=Nebraska head coaches|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskers.com//pdf7/134546.pdf|title=118 Years of Cornhusker Football|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=University of nebraska Athletics Department}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{Cite web|url=http://yearbooks.unl.edu/yearbook.php?year=1907&page=177|title=1907 Sombrero - University of Nebraska Yearbook|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=University of NebraskaâLincoln Libraries}} ==Game notes== ===Hastings===
'''Hastings at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Hastings College|Hastings]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 56
* '''Date:''' 1906-09-29 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ [[Lincoln, Nebraska]]
Nebraska opened the season under new coach Foster with a solid shutout performance against Hastings College in the first meeting of these teams. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===South Dakota===
'''South Dakota at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[South Dakota Coyotes football|South Dakota]] 000
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 044
* '''Date:''' 1906-10-06 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
South Dakota seemed to have figured out how to shut down Nebraska's offense, forcing the Cornhuskers to win with field goals instead of touchdowns. The low-scoring affair was Nebraska's third win in four games against the Coyotes. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Drake===
'''Drake at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Drake Bulldogs football|Drake]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 5
* '''Date:''' 1906-10-13 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
For the second week in a row, as the offense struggled, the Nebraska defense came through and kept the other team off the board so that Nebraska's single touchdown was enough to get the win. It had been five years since these teams last met, and Nebraska extended the series lead to 3-1. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Iowa State===
'''Iowa State at Nebraska'''
12Total
'''â¢ {{cfb link|year=1906|school=Iowa State University|team=Iowa State Cyclones|title=Iowa State}}''' 14
Nebraska 2
* '''Date:''' 1906-10-20 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Nebraska's home field winning streak of 38 straight games (including exhibition games) dating back to the beginning of the 1901 season was broken when Iowa State took advantage of the Cornhuskers' struggling offensive output. A late safety prevented Nebraska from being shut out, and Iowa State reduced their series deficit to 3-5. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Doane===
'''Doane at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Doane College|Doane]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 28
* '''Date:''' 1906-10-27 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Nebraska again defeated Doane in Lincoln, in a shutout win, to try to erase the memory of the previous week's home field loss. Nebraska's lead in the series was increasingly getting out of reach at 10-2. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Minnesota===
'''Nebraska at Minnesota'''
12Total
Nebraska 000
'''â¢ [[1906 Minnesota Golden Gophers football team|Minnesota]]''' 01313
* '''Date:''' 1906-11-03 * '''Location:''' Northrop Field â¢ [[Minneapolis|Minneapolis, Minnesota]]
Nebraska's frustration with rival Minnesota was continued as the Golden Gophers again shut out the Cornhuskers in Minneapolis for the second year in a row, which was also Nebraska's third loss to Minnesota over the past three years. The defensive fight kept the scoreboard empty until the second half, when Minnesota again broke through and extended their lead over Nebraska to 5-1. Minnesota would go on to finish as [[Big Ten Conference|Big Nine]] Co-Champion. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Creighton===
'''Creighton at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Creighton Bluejays|Creighton]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 17
* '''Date:''' 1906-11-10 * '''Location:''' [[Omaha, Nebraska]]
Nebraska bounced back from the demoralizing loss at Minnesota by putting away Creighton in Omaha, notching another shutout win. This was the final time these teams would meet, the record ending with all three wins in the Nebraska column. Nebraska finished with wins against all in-state teams for the third year in a row to claim another state championship. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Kansas===
'''Kansas at Nebraska'''
12Total
'''â¢ {{cfb link|year=1906|school=University of Kansas|team=Kansas Jayhawks|title=Kansas}}''' 808
Nebraska 606
* '''Date:''' 1906-11-17 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
After a three year break, Kansas and Nebraska met on the field again. The series afterward would continue uninterrupted for over one hundred years, and as of 2009 is scheduled to continue at least through 2015 and likely longer. Multiple Cornhusker mistakes cost Nebraska the game on this day, resulting in the second home field loss for the Cornhuskers this season. Nebraska's lead in the series slipped to just 7-6. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Chicago===
'''Nebraska at Chicago'''
12Total
Nebraska 5
'''â¢ [[Chicago Maroons football|Chicago]]''' 38
* '''Date:''' 1906-11-24 * '''Location:''' [[Stagg Field]] â¢ [[Chicago, Illinois]]
Nebraska traveled to Chicago to meet the City's University squad for the first time. At that time, Chicago was a member of the vaunted [[Big Ten Conference|Big Nine Conference]]. The conference reputation was apparently well-deserved, as the Cornhuskers struggled to make serious progress while Chicago rolled up 38 points and sent them home with their 4th loss of the season. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ===Cincinnati===
'''Cincinnati at Nebraska'''
12Total
[[Cincinnati Bearcats football|Cincinnati]] 0
'''â¢ Nebraska''' 41
* '''Date:''' 1906-11-29 * '''Location:''' Antelope Field â¢ Lincoln, Nebraska
Coach Foster's former team, Cincinnati, traveled to Nebraska for the only time to date that these teams would meet. It was a positive end to a season of some disappointment for the Cornhuskers, as the Cincinnati team was sent back home to Ohio smarting from a 0-41 blanking. {{Cite web|url=http://www.huskernews.com/vnews/display.v/ART/2006/05/13/44788622a8765?in_archive=1|title=1906 Game Recaps|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=Husker Press Box}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.huskermax.com/1900s.html|title=the 1900s|accessdate=2009-11-15|publisher=HuskerMax}} {{-}} ==After the season== Coach Foster only made it through this one year before moving on. His previous coaching job was again offered to him, but he instead passed that post up and went to coach for [[Miami University]] in Ohio, where he compiled a 13-1 record in his two years there. Foster's one-year Nebraska record of 6-4-0 (.600) caused a slight drop in Nebraska's overall program record, which fell to 93-37-5 (.707). ==References== {{Reflist}} {{NebraskaCornhuskersFootballNavbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:1906 Nebraska Cornhuskers Football Team}} [[Category:Nebraska Cornhuskers football seasons]] [[Category:1906 Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States football season|Nebraska]]
